pullRequest.body:
This is tracking PR for rewriting most linters in `lint-style.py` in Lean.

---

Steps for landing this:
- [x] land #13620: basic infrastructure and the "file length" linter
- [x] land #14057, to move the executable out of `Mathlib/Tactic`
  - [ ] land #14272 to fix the exit code
- [x] land #13240: basic infrastructure and the copyright linter
  - [x] normalise copyright headers: land #13212
  - [x] adding missing copyright years: land #13247
- [x] land #14058 and #14059 (next two linters)
- [x] land #14273, rewriting the updating of style exceptions in Lean
- [x] land #12928, which becomes a syntax linter, [ ] and its fix-up #14006
- [ ] verify that windows line endings are still caught: Lean's `IO.FS.lines` method returns lines without newline; I have not checked if this still works in the Windows case (help testing welcome; I don't have access to a Windows computer!)
- [x] I had, for the fun of it, dialed up the "lonely by" linter: either fix the offenders (#13203, #13204 and possibly more; some work) or dial it down again
- [ ] strengthen import-only check to remove the false positive? deal with commented #align
- [ ] make sure all definitions follow the naming convention (can be done with each PR)
- [x] optimise this linter: after compiling the linter, it's **5x faster** than Python: takes 2-3s, instead of 10
~~after one and a half rounds of optimisation, it's perhaps twice as slow as the python script was (with a few lints missing). See the inline comments for some details: on my machine, the Python script (before the rewrite, with a few more linters) takes ~12-14 seconds, which these linters take ~20-25s.~~
- how to integrate this into existing CI: this has two parts
  - failing CI upon build error: integrate the `lint_style` executable into the build workflow; works nicely
  - updating style exceptions: call the `update_style_exceptions` executable; this can run both the python script and the Lean linter (not implemented yet).
- [ ] open for discussion: the fixes of the line length warnings

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I'm not at all an expert in speed ups, but is there a chance that putting all the line-filtering in a single "master" linter and then differentiating later the error message be an improvement?

My idea is that this way you scan the lines only once and lint everything, rather than having to separately scan all the lines for each linter.  I'm not sure what is better.

From a reviewing point of view, it might be better to create an initial PR with just one linter and then gradually adding the rest.  This also helps not holding back all the linters, since one is controversial.
Makes sense; I'll probably do that. If you wish, #12928 is the first such PR; rewriting the copyright (and adding most infrastructure) can be the next one.
I filed #13240 for rewriting the copyright check.
As a way to roll this out, I have rewritten `update_style_exceptions.sh` as a Lean executable: this allows both linters to co-exist.
Compiling the linter to an executable makes it **much** faster: now it's an order of magnitude *faster* than the Python linter.
I think this PR has served its purpose; closing.

pullRequest.title: [Tracking PR] feat: rewrite most style linters in Lean

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - style: remove last isolated where
chore: remove style linter for windows line endings
[Merged by Bors] - chore: normalise copyright headers
